review_blob:
Really nice grab bag of Belgian stereotypes. Slightly sour nose, funky and citric. The taste is less tart, with allspice and pepper notes intermingling with the acidity. The mouthfeel is surprisingly creamy, which isn't surprising considering the rich head on pouring. Really enjoyable bottle.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

First, really amazing packaging and graphics - the old-time look is super appealing and enticing. Not a whole lot of nose to the beer, but it looks good poured, with a rich golden color and thick head. 

On tasting, it becomes clear that this is a very generic IPA - and I mean that as a compliment. It scratches every itch that I have when I think I want an IPA, and it does so in a really satisfying manner. 

This beer is going to find an i ping home in my fridge.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

A solid, if unspectacular pale ale. Nice to look at, copper with creamy head, and nice on the nose, although nothing really stood out. Great taste and mouthfeel, but reminiscent of late-90's pale ales - I would have been happy to get this at a restaurant with limited options, but was underwhelmed by it in a taproom with 20 other options. Regret is an ugly mistress.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: The Civil Life American Pale Ale

review_blob:
I thought this beer was terrific, although it's not something I'll likely find myself craving in the future - especially at 8 bucks for 12 oz.. There were traces of flavors from all of the varied aging barrels, especially the bitterness of the liqueurs. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I liked this beer a lot out of a can, but I couldn't help but feel that it would have been more successful if they had tried for either a "Belgian" or a classic "IPA". Looking forward to trying on tap.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really pretty mahogany pour, with a quickly dissipating creamy head. I didn't read the deScription before buying, so I was surprised by the lack of spice (or flavor, for that matter) in this "winter" beer. Great ever recent mouthfeel, but really understated flavor - slight woody notes, a little molasses, maybe, and slight malt. Really reminded me of something that you'd be served at a big chain brewpub in an airport.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice nose - lots of understated elements at play - chocolate, vanilla, slight citrus. Jet black with slight head on tap. Mouthfeel is crisp - almost no creaminess at all. First flavors are chocolate and slight coffee, quickly tapering with the citrus - the end result is almost a root beer sensation. Really solid beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pour from a can at Grinders. Nice to look at - deep orange with a creamy head. Bold nose, generic hops, with a touch of citrus. Taste is nice blend of flavors, without any real character or dominant traits. Texture is sticky. Overall, a solid beer, but not life-changing by any stretch.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I loved this beer. It's amazing to look at, bright pink with a quickly dissipating fluffy head. Nose hits all of the classic gose notes, with a slightly floral edge. Taste matches, with prominent citrus, salt and a floral, herbaceous tone. Crisp and refreshing, I wish there had been more made available.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice golden color, with a rich white head. Citric nose, heavy on the hops. Taste doesn't quite live up to the smell, but still a very, very agreeable IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really tart nose, heavy on the brett and citrus. Taste is thin and crisp, and not nearly as sour as the nose would indicate. Bright star color with a thin head.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Evil Twin / Crooked Stave Ryan And The Gosling

review_blob:
Bright and crisp, lactic & funky. Nice salty undertones. Really nice gose in a can.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Anderson Valley Highway 128 The Kimmie, The Yink, and the Holy Gose

review_blob:
Nice enough, but nothing special on tap at stroud's. Malty, bready, and slightly sweet...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This IPA is perfectly suited to my tastes right now - well balanced between citrus and piney notes, crisp on the palette, and easy to drink. Terrific on tap, just as good in a mini-growler. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bright golden red color with creamy head. Great nose, with traces of peach, melon and light pine. Viscous mouthfeel. Nice beer, but not quite what it was cracked up to be.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Absolute brute of a beer - in a good way. Straightforward IPA characteristics, hiding a big ABV. Smooth drinking - almost too smooth. Loved it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Oskar Blues Deviant Dales India Pale Ale

review_blob:
Clear chestnut pour with a rich creamy head. Earthy nose with slight vinegar hints. Nice beer, but much less sour than I had expected.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Beautiful bright yellow pour with a thick shaving cream head that takes forever to break down. Nice nose, tart and herbal, with a crisp taste to match. This one seems to split the difference between the Tank 7 and the Saison Brett, and is perfect for the warm weather.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap at boulevardia. Cloudy butter yellow with a soapy head. Nose is acidic with hints of apple vinegar and black pepper. Mouthfeel is very thin, almost watered down. Flavor has light citrus, some apple notes and spice. Slightly reminiscent of a gose, but not particularly interesting - especially with Love Child being poured from the adjacent tap handle...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really nice session IPA. Crisp nose, with hops at the front. Nice copper-hinted golden color, with a creamy white head. Taste is good, but clearly low gravity. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I really wanted to like this, and I hoped for some sort of exceptional character. It didn't work for me - it just reminded me of beer and wine mixed together. I thinks it's probably well made, it's just not for me.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice to look at - coca cola pour. Three words on the taste: "dis", "gus", & "ting".

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: New Belgium / Three Floyds Lips Of Faith - Grtzer Ale

review_blob:
Nice herbal nose, very malty backdrop for a range of flavors, including pepper, bread, banana and a general floral note. A nice beer, clearly well crafted, but a bit too cloying.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 release. Cloudy straw body, with a soapy white head. Light lacing. Nose is herbaceous and spicy - slightly citric. Taste is lightly tart, again citric, and many of the spicy notes from the nose aren't apparent. Velvety texture, yet also crisp on the palette. Really nice summertime beer - very reminiscent of a seasoned gose.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Boulevard Smokestack Series - Two Jokers Double-Wit

review_blob:
Cloudy straw yellow Belgian nose with mostly west coast IPA taste. Nice enough, but nothing out of this world.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good looking black IPA with a deep mahogany color and an airy, lasting tan head. Taste is very slightly malty, with strong notes of pine and citrus. Crisp mouthfeel with a pleasant dry finish.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really wanted to like this one, but the cinnamon overwhelmed me. Lots (perhaps too many) flavors battling in this beer, but the cinnamon beat them all into submission. I will try again, as it may have been a bad night for my palette...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a can - nice orange straw color, rich off white head. Nose was both malty and hoppy, lots of grapefruit. Initial taste was great, but faded into bitterness - I like this. Very happy to finally be able to get this in cans...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled (over and over and over) at boulevardia. Spectacular beer - buttery yellow color with a faint head. Assertive funky nose, with a citrus hint. Taste matches, with a lingering tartness on the tongue. I look forward to going back to this one.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Sampled at boulevardia. Absolutely perfect sour. Rich ruby-tinged color, nice head, and a robust, fruity tart nose. Taste is bold, matching the nose, but is also a bit of a palette wrecker. Spectacular beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Samples at boulevardia. Straw color with huge head. Nice citric nose. Light salt and pleasantly tart. Very nice gose.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Can. Nice hoppy nose with a taste that follows. Slight resinous pine, grapefruit, and malty caramel. Drinks well from can.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I thought I was back in the fatherland - this is a great, classic pilsner. Perfectly poured at the brewery. I'd wish for a touch more hops, but that's a very slight complaint.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Gray copper color with thick head and nice lacing. Solid piney nose. Crisp flavors with a slight hint of citrus. Terrific beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nice copper color, but fairly flat, with almost no head when served on tap. Nose and flavors were nice, but not nearly what I expected given the reputation of this beer. Maybe my palette had an off night - I will try again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Nothing wrong with this beer, but also nothing to recommend it. Classic pale ale, but with zero character.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Brilliant yellow with a faint white head in tap. Amazing nose, as ginger, light malt and an array of citrus battle it out. The taste matches - huge flavors and eminently refreshing. Flavor turns a bit sweet for my tastes as the beer warms, need to remember to knock these down faster...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap into a pint glass. Got to my table warm and flat, but it was a nice orange color. Lots of hops, but the expansive blend seems to keep the flavor from being overwhelming. Nice, interesting IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

On tap into a small chalice. Not much to look at, but lots to smell. Busy, busy nose, great zesty taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Really good initial nose, heavy on the hops, and really assertive. Nice thick mouthfeel, matching the thick, sticky lacing. Flavor changes as the beer opens up - hops recedes, and a malty note becomes more prominent. All in all, a really nice big IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Unless you happen to be trapped at a party far out in the country, miles from the nearest liquor store, and your alcohol choices are this or a bud light strawberita, there's not much reason to drink this. 

I was. 
I did. 
I wish I hadn't.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Blue Moon Short Straw Farmhouse Red Ale

review_blob:
Better than a bud, I guess. Next to no real character, texture, smell or interest to this beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: Blue Moon Rounder Belgian Style Pale

review_blob:
Good, but nothing special. Great nose, good looks, and a fine flavor (heavy on the pine, which is good by me). Clearly a well-crafted west coast IPA, but with so many standouts in the category, this one doesn't rise above...

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Holy smokes, did I every love this beer. Chestnut brown pout with a thin tan head. Lightly carbonated on tap. Amazing fruity tart nose, with a touch of funk. On tasting, the sour was ramped up a couple of notches - wow! The mouthfeel was slightly sticky, but in this context it worked. I loved it.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Just about perfect west coast IPA. Great piney nose, flavor to match, with a rich golden color with a creamy head. On tap at Palms, perhaps over carbonated here - overly crisp and bubbly, but a minor complaint. Terrific beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

I had high hopes for this one, and came away disappointed. The initial pour was pretty, grapefruit pink with a crisp head, but the effervescence totally disappeared within a minute or two. The nose had a bit of a barnyard sour smell to it, although notes of yeast and urine became apparent a the longer it say out. Taste was underwhelming, muddled tropical fruit, slightly bitter, and not particularly assertive. Meh.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Just a really solid classic microbrew IPA. Citrus and pine nose with a crisp flavor that just tastes like "beer". 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Good looking, nice nose and superb flavors. Nothing extraordinary, but well worth having again.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Hands down, one of the single most disgusting beers I've ever tasted. The nose was way over the top, a crazed mishmash of flavors, and the taste was worse. It was also sticky. Very, very sticky.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
beer_name: HeBrew Reunion - A Beer For Hope 2013 (Shmaltz Brewing)

review_blob:
Slightly cloudy, rose-pink color, with an old-lace head that quickly dissipates. Nose is slightly tart cherry, followed by some slightly tart cherry. Taste is significantly more sour, although the berry and cherry notes come through loud and clear. Crisp and light, with almost a fruit soda profile. Terrific for the style. Not too sweet.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
